identity.name: Human-First HR Design System
identity.philosophy: Bold, playful, emotionally intelligent - HR that feels like talking to a friend, not a department. High energy meets high empathy.
identity.targetUse: HR communications, employee engagement, culture content, onboarding, celebrations, internal campaigns

electric-blue.usage: Primary background, main brand color, hero sections
electric-blue.psychology: Trust, innovation, energy, professionalism with personality

neon-lime.usage: Highlight text, decorative shapes, CTAs, success states, growth themes

neutrals.usage: Text on blue, card backgrounds (when needed)

primaryCombinations: Electric blue BG + white type + neon lime accents
Electric blue BG + white type + sunny yellow elements
Electric blue BG + mix of all accent colors (playful)
White BG + electric blue elements + accent highlights
colorRules.contrast: ALWAYS high contrast - white on blue, never light-on-light
colorRules.accentUsage: Use 2-3 accent colors per composition for visual interest
colorRules.gradients: Subtle tonal gradients within accent colors (yellow to orange, lime to teal)

typography.philosophy: Personality-driven type mixing - casual script for emotion + bold sans for impact

display.usage: Main headlines, key words, hero text
display.characteristics: Very bold, rounded terminals, friendly but strong

script.usage: Introductory phrases, emotional context, personal touches

hero-combo.spacing: Minimal gap between script and main word (-10 to -20px overlap)
hero-combo.alignment: Center or left, depending on composition

single-word-impact.structure: One massive bold word with decorative elements
single-word-impact.size: As large as possible while maintaining readability

caseUsage.principle: Avoid ALL CAPS except for tiny labels/tags

organicShapes.colors: Accent colors - neon lime, yellow, orange, cyan
organicShapes.placement: Edges, corners, behind text, asymmetric balance

styles.tonal-gradient: Same color family, lighter in center
styles.decorative-background: Darker blue than main BG, huge scale, partial visibility

3D-elements.philosophy: Quasi-3D with soft shadows and highlights - not hyper-realistic, playful 3D

techniques.gradient-shading: Light source from top-left, darker at bottom-right
techniques.highlights: Bright spot or edge on top surface

3D-elements.color-treatment: Base color + 2-3 tones (lighter highlight, darker shadow)

confetti.shapes: Small rectangles, lines, dots, mini shapes

starbursts.style: Radiating lines or pointed star shapes

hero-centered.structure: Center-aligned, dominant headline, decorative elements around edges
hero-centered.background: Electric blue with oversized decorative circles

minimal-impact.structure: Massive single word, minimal decoration, maximum negative space
minimal-impact.principle: Let the word breathe, add only 3-5 small elements

layering.overlap: Intentional overlap creates depth and interest

balance.approach: Dynamic asymmetry - feels balanced but not mirror-image
balance.weight-distribution: Heavy element one side balanced by multiple small elements other side
balance.visual-flow: Eye movement in Z or circular pattern

monthly-theme.headline: 'month name' large and bold
elements: Theme-appropriate icon (heart for Feb, sun for summer)

wellness-benefits.headline: 'caring for' (script) + 'you' (bold)
wellness-benefits.colors: Blue BG + red/pink hearts + cyan wellness

animation-motion.philosophy: Playful but not chaotic - things should float, bounce, pulse

micro-interactions.rotate: Slow rotation for decorative elements (360Â° in 20-30s)

page-transitions.stagger: Elements appear in sequence (0.1s delay between)

tone-of-voice.principle: Talk like a human, not a policy document

messaging-hierarchy.supporting: 1-2 sentence max (if needed, in body text)

colorContrast.accent-on-blue: Lime, yellow must be adjusted for legibility if used for text
colorContrast.solution: Use white for all critical text, accents for decoration only

typography.scriptUsage: Always paired with clear sans-serif, never alone for critical info

alternatives.pattern: If color-coding info, add icon or pattern too
alternatives.text: All icon-only communications need text alternative

fileFormats.print: 300dpi, CMYK color mode for physical materials
fileFormats.digital-screens: 72dpi, RGB, various sizes for TV screens/kiosks

non-negotiables: At least one organic/playful shape per composition
flexibleElements: Which accent colors to use (pick 1-3 per piece)
Specific decorative elements (but must be playful)

designSystem.aiImplementationPrompt: When creating HR graphics with this system: Start with electric blue (#0046FF) background. Add huge, subtle decorative circles in darker blue at edges (partially cropped). Place main headline in massive bold white sans-serif, lowercase. Add emotional context with casual script in neon lime above or beside. Scatter 2-4 organic blob shapes in bright accents (lime, yellow, orange). Include 1-2 3D-style icons or emojis relevant to theme. Keep generous margins (100px+). Use asymmetric balance - heavy headline one side, playful elements balancing the other. Maximum 3 accent colors. White text only, never light-on-light. This should feel like optimistic startup culture meets professional HR - energetic but trustworthy, playful but purposeful. Think 'HR that makes people actually want to engage.'
